MSI English School is a product of deeper thoughts to refute this situation. It aims at educating youngsters and teenagers following the central syllabus itself along with Islamic Studies which is the most effective cotemporary educational network. This institution assures smart classes, well equipped and efficient science and computer labs for every learners from L.K.G to XII. With every swiftness and easiness above 1000 students find out their resort to education Since technical and vocational training is boon Technological application of science is leading every county to its front lore.we aim at moldings a generation of youngesters who are committed experts, technologists coped with values and virtues. It offers course of Architectural Assistantd, Health sanitary inspector, Draughtsman civil. Which are the traders from this engineering non engineering circuit. Students have successfully completed their courses and have achieved high ranks including All India level examination Initially, started with an enrolment of a few Orphans and the destitute , over the years it has grown as a destination of a large number of aspirants for higher education and care for the weaker sections deprived of parents, and close relatives. This Orphans cum Destitute Home addresses all the problems of the inmates food, accommodation, treatment, clothes and education and even placement, etc . The people in the surroundings do support to the noble cause initiated by Majma in order to make this institution with more facilities to accommodate more inmates form the state and outside. The children are given value-based education in an conducive cultural ambiance. They are protected from the negative influence of unhealthy and un-Islamic practices inflicted on a major chunk of new generation.

title: Nagarjuna Social Service Society
detailsOfAchievement: The medicinal plants conservation programme initiated at Nagarjuna Social Service Society in 2001 aimed at conservation and revitalization of traditional system of healthcare practices through sustainable use of locally available medicinal plants. An inventory was conducted in the district and reported 600 important medicinal plants. A Nursery for multiplication of commercially important and plants for primary healthcare and a green house for exhibiting ecologically and economically important plants were established. Conducting awareness programmes, field visits, medicinal plants exhibition as well as preparation of educational materials such as booklets, posters, CDs, charts in local languages. A total of 25 SHGs of woman from poor financial backgrouns were constitued in Idukki district consists of 250 members. They were given training in cultivation, conservation, preparation of medicines and scientific harvesting techniques. NSSS already produced more than 35 lakhs seedlings and distributed to public, educational institutions, religious organization and in tribal communities. NSSS conducted 2000 training classes among medicinal plants cultivation to above mentioned communities. Leaflets, articles, CDs supports used. More over 200 TV episodes also telecasted. Major projects sanctioned by Govt. of India and Kerala Govt. followed. Donor agencies WGDP, NMPB, NEAC, KINFR and SMPB Kerala

title: Natanakairali
detailsOfAchievement: Founded in 1975 by G. Venu with the idea of reviving and rejuvenating traditional art forms of Kerala that were on the verge of decline. An internationally renowned centre for performing arts with uncompromising standards of performance based on a rigorous training system following the Gurukula tradition. Natanakairalis troupes of Kutiyattam (Sanskrit theatre), Mohiniyattam and Pavakathakali (Glove puppetry) have performed all over India in National festivals and several International festivals in Asian, European countries and in United States several times. Natanakairali is documenting and publishing the Mudras in the classical dance and theatre forms of Kerala through the medium of dance notation. Several volumes of documented mudras have been published and disseminated through publications in Malayalam as well as in English. Natanakairali publication wing has brought out 16 books based on research conducted on subjects related to the art forms of Kerala. Natanakairali is managed by a core team of peforming artistes and masters whose main pre-occupation is teaching and performing traditional arts of Kerala.
